SEPTEMBER 12, 2022
5:30 PM
SULLIVAN CHAMBER

aMEETING

Monday, September 12, 2022

TIME

5:30 PM

PRESIDING OFFICER

Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui

1. Minutes of the City Council - Regular Meeting - Jun 21, 2021 5:30 PM
RESULT:
YEAS:
ACCEPTED [9-0-0]
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

Sep 12, 2022

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to a COVID-19 and
Monkeypox update.
CMA 2022 #168
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Simmons

2. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report Item
Number 22-54, regarding the Cambridge Public Health Department's response to monkeypox.
CMA 2022 #169
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

3. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the transfer of $180,000
in the General Fund between School Department statutory accounts as follows: $180,000 from the
School Department Other Ordinary Maintenance account to the School Department Travel and
Training account ($180,000) to cover to cover a legal settlement.
CMA 2022 #170
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

4. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the recommendations of
the Community Preservation Act Committee (CPAC) for FY2023.
CMA 2022 #171
RESULT:
18 ORDERS ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 4

Sep 12, 2022

RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

Mayor Siddiqui

Mayor Siddiqui

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. 105 Windsor Community Process.
POR 2022 #142
Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

ON THE TABLE
2. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to direct the Director of the Traffic, Parking,
and Transportation Department to limit the blocking off of Memorial Drive to vehicular traffic to
Sundays
POR 2022 #102
Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor
McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui

3. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the
appropriation of appropriation and authorization to borrow $4,500,000 to provide funds for the
design and construction of building renovations to the vacant City owned property at 105
Windsor Street.
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR ZONDERVAN
IN COUNCIL JUNE 27, 2022 TABLED IN COUNCIL AUGUST 1, 2022
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL SEPTEMBER 12, 2022
TO BE ADOPTED ON OR AFTER OCTOBER 3, 2022
CMA 2022 #142
RESULT:
PASSED TO A SECOND READING

PAGE 7

Next: 9/19/2022 5:30 PM

Sep 12, 2022

4. An application was received from Andy layman representing Tasty Burger, requesting permission
for three (3) projecting signs at the premises numbered 23 Prospect Street. approval has been
received from Inspectional Services, Department of Public Works, Community Development
Department and abutter.
APP 2022 #37
RESULT:
PLACED ON THE TABLE

Next: 9/19/2022 5:30 PM

UNFINISHED BUSINESS

Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. An application was received from Richard Burg representing Coldwell Banker Realty, requesting
permission for an awning at the premises numbered 1726 Massachusetts Avenue. Approval has been
received from Inspectional Services, Department of Public Works, Community Development
Department and abutters.
APP 2022 #40
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

2. An application was received from Kevin Rosenberg representing Chestnut Hill Realty, requesting
permission for an awning at the premises numbered 1640 Massachusetts Avenue. Approval has been
received from Inspectional Services, Department of Public Works, Community Development
Department and abutters.
APP 2022 #41
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

3. An application was received from Lewis Colten, requesting permission for a curb cut at the premises
numbered 318 Concord Avenue; said petition has received approval from Inspectional Services,
Traffic, Parking and Transportation, Historical Commission and Public Works. Response has been
received from the neighborhood association.
APP 2022 #42
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR NOLAN
Next: 9/19/2022 5:30 PM

PAGE 9

Sep 12, 2022

YEAS:

Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 16

Sep 12, 2022

PAGE 20

Sep 12, 2022

VI. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the City Manager is requested work with the Cambridge Historical Commission, DPW, the
Dedication Committee, and any other relevant City departments to create a system to document the
histories of those honored, and to make those histories available to the public, including but not
limited to a website on the City’s web page or a QR code on each sign.
POR 2022 #152
Councillor McGovern, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem, Councillor Toner
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

2. That the City Council urge the MBTA to reverse its decision to reconfigure and reduce service along
the 47 Bus Line and take whatever steps are necessary to return it to its previous level of service.
POR 2022 #153
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

3. That the City Manager is requested to direct the appropriate City staff to establish a fund designed to
assist those City employees in same-sex marriages with paying for surrogacy services in instances
where the City’s health insurance providers fail to provide the same coverage afforded to the City’s
female employees and those in heterosexual marriages.
POR 2022 #154
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Azeem, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Toner
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [8-0-1]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Mayor Siddiqui

ABSENT:

Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 21

Sep 12, 2022

4. That the City Manager is requested to direct the Public Works Department to repair the grass at
Greene-Rose Heritage Park, and to establish a long- term plan of action to ensure that the park is
well-maintained in perpetuity.
POR 2022 #155
Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

5. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Department of Public Works, the Traffic,
Parking & Transportation Department, and other relevant departments to revise the City block party
and play streets signature requirements to a more reasonable threshold, and shorten the timeline
between application and event date, and provide more guidance to residents seeking a permit.
POR 2022 #156
Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Nolan, Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

6. That the City Manager is requested to light up City Hall purple for the week of September 19th, in
honor of Suicide Prevention Month and recognize September 2022 as Suicide Prevention Month in
Cambridge.
POR 2022 #157
Mayor Siddiqui, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

7. That the Dedication Committee hold a special meeting to expedite the process of naming the corner
of Brookline Street and Franklin Street in honor of Peter Valentine.
POR 2022 #158
Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Simmons
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui


PAGE 22

Sep 12, 2022

8. That the Health and Environment Committee of the City Council hold a public hearing to discuss the
issue of PFAS and overall water quality and work with the City Manager, the Water Board, and
relevant city staff to set up the initial meeting this fall.
POR 2022 #159
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Zondervan, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Azeem
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED AND REFERRED TO THE HEALTH AND
ENVIRONMENT COMMITTEE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

9. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to communicate to the Cambridge Health Alliance
the City Council’s support for the reopening of the Cambridge Birth Center for deliveries as soon as
possible and City Council support for the protection of existing birth centers and the creation of new
birth centers in Cambridge.
POR 2022 #160
Councillor Nolan, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Vice Mayor Mallon
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

10. That the City Council refer the zoning petition regarding lab use to the Ordinance Committee and
Planning Board for a hearing and report. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR
TONER IN COUNCIL SEPTEMBER 12, 2022
POR 2022 #161
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor McGovern
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR TONER
Next: 9/19/2022 5:30 PM

11. That the Ordinances of the City of Cambridge be amended as it relates to Permitting Preferences for
Priority Applicants. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR TONER IN COUNCIL
SEPTEMBER 12, 2022
POR 2022 #162
Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR TONER
Next: 9/19/2022 5:30 PM

PAGE 23

Sep 12, 2022

12. That the City Manager direct the City Solicitor answer any legal questions that came up during the
discussion that occurred during the regular City Council meeting on September, 12th.
POR 2022 #163
Mayor Siddiqui, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Councillor
Simmons, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
Councillor Nolan, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toner, Councillor Zondervan,
Mayor Siddiqui

13. Request that the City Manager ask the City Solicitor to prepare a legal opinion on the following
questions regarding Policy Order #11 from the September 12, 2022 City Council meeting.
POR 2022 #164
Councillor Toner, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Councillor
Simmons, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Zondervan, Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor McGovern,
